page.title: 02Haymaking
page.content: At the time of the survey-June/July,the preoccupation of most farmers was haymaking.Few of the farms were purely arable so that often early morning was spent feeding and checking stock while fields dried.The later morning might be spent turning the hay ready for baling or greasing and maintaining machinery.Several older workers remembered haymaking by hand and one specified the date of the first tractor he had seen-an International in 1921.For the afternoon and evening the farmers tried to cut or bale as much as they could-some talked of working til 10p.m.in good weather.They ensured all bales were covered with sheets before finishing.
